result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew Michael Dentice

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing on December 19, 2022 at 09:30 am.

3:38 PM Defendant Matthew Michael Dentice in court.  Attorney Brett E Reetz in court for Matthew Michael Dentice.  Attorney Aleksandra Hodowany. in court for State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews events in file, questions where matter is at Atty Reetz requests doing plea today, sentencing another day. Minute sheet. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters guilty plea to ct 1.  Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds plea made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds guilty of ct.1. Count 2 & 3 dismissed but read in for sentencing.  Bond remains in effect.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 19, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 31, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Defense waives reading of Information and enters not guilty plea. Atty Reetz advises they have a global offer to resolve both files, requests a plea date be set.  Bond remains in effect.

1:30 PM  Defendant Matthew Michael Dentice in court.  Attorney Brett E Reetz in court for Matthew Michael Dentice.  Prosecuting attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews events in file.  Defense waives right to Prelim. Court questions defendant on waiver. Court finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds over for trial. Court finds probable cause for bindover.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on August 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

No contact direct or indirect with D.H., her residence or place of employment.  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then take only in the amount and frequency prescribed. Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia. Maintain absolute sobriety. No presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores or any establishment whose primary purpose is the sale and/or consumption of alcohol except for employment purposes. Not to possess or consume any alcohol.

2:18 PM   Defendant Matthew Michael Dentice appeared by video from the Door County Jail.  Attorney Shannon Viel in court for Matthew Michael Dentice.  Attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin in court for State of Wisconsin.  Atty Viel indicates defendant does qualify for SPD representation in this new file.   Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel, right to prelim.  Atty Viel waives reading of the complaint, requests balance of IA be set.   Court questions defendant on missed attorney payments.  Defendant explains why he hasn't made any payments toward his attorney fees. Atty Reetz also present in court, is willing to take new case also. Atty Viel will have SPD appt Atty. Reetz in this matter   Court questions defendant on address/employment.  Bond set.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
